results.question: What will you learn in the Web Programming for Apps and Services course?
results.correct_answer: Creating web client apps that work with a web service

results.question: Which programming language is a foundational concept in the course?
Which server stack is used in the course?
What is the role of front end web client development?
results.correct_answer: Creating the user interface and interacting with users

results.question: Which libraries are used in the course for web client development?
What tools and applications will you use in the course?
results.correct_answer: Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Visual Studio Code
incorrect_answers: C#, Visual Studio, SQL Server, Atom

results.question: If you have problems using your personal computer for the course work, what should you do?
results.correct_answer: Seek help from your professor or classmates

results.question: What is the recommended action if you cannot solve a problem within 20 to 30 minutes?
results.correct_answer: Seek help from your professor or classmates
incorrect_answers: Keep trying until you solve it
Take a break and try again later

results.question: What should you do before coming to a class with a test?
results.correct_answer: Read and study the notes, read and study the linked documents, make your own notes
incorrect_answers: Skip the class and study on your own

results.question: What are the expectations from you in the Lecture class?
results.correct_answer: Listen effectively, ask and answer questions, write notes, do in-class exercises and activities
incorrect_answers: Skip the class and do other assignments
Talk to your friends and ignore the lecture

results.question: What is the purpose of this document?
results.correct_answer: To design and create a simple web service
incorrect_answers: To test the Thunder Client Extension
To generate mock data using Mockaroo

results.question: Which tool should be installed if the system does not have the Node.js app dev ecosystem?
What is the entry point specified when initializing the Node.js app?
Which package is installed using the npm command?
What message does the console.log() statement in server.js output?
incorrect_answers: 'Ready to handle requests on port ' + HTTP_PORT

results.question: What HTTP method is used to fetch all items from the web service?
What is the URL path to fetch all items?
What does the HTTP POST request allow the requestor to do?
results.correct_answer: Add a new item to the collection

results.question: What is the value of the Content-Type header in the HTTP POST request?
What response status code must be returned after successfully adding a new item?
What is the purpose of the express.static() function in server.js?
results.correct_answer: To deliver static files (e.g., index.html) to browser clients
incorrect_answers: To handle resource not found errors

results.question: What HTTP method is used to edit an existing item in the collection?
What is the URL path to edit an existing item?
